content.description:
This is the last route on the wall going up the canyon. The climb starts in a small overhang. Left of

Flea Market

.
content.protection: You only need 6 draws for this route. 4 for the bolts and 2 for the chain anchors up top. Well protected, but you don't want to fall between the 2nd and 3rd bolt. Ouch

content.description:
Just left of the

Road Kill Wall's

small separating groove/gully is this short, featured route. A very well protected line with great clipping stances. A great first lead for someone new to climbing.
content.protection: 2 anchors at the top and about 6 or 7 draws.
4 bolts, chain anchors (shared with route to right).
content.location: Third route right of the groove/depression in the middle of the wall. Shares chains with route to right.

content.description:
Just left of

Canned Beaver

are these anchors.  Step left

The book describes this climb as "built to last," and it sure will!  A closely-spaced bolt pattern with good climbing and a summit view reward the climber, beginner or intermediate, with enough entertaining moves (mostly at the bottom).  If it wasn't for the middle section with a little moss, it would be 4 stars.
content.location: Second route from the far right of the wall.  First route left of the overhanging 5.10c, Burlap Kitty.

content.description: 2nd route right of a groove--4 bolts to anchors
content.protection: 2 anchors are at the top, and 4 draws for the climb
content.location: Second route right of the groove/depression in the middle of the wall.

content.description: The crux is the first fifteen feet.  It then eases up for about sixty feet of fun climbing.
content.location: The first long route that is just to the right of the water groove.

content.description:
Just up from

Massengile

is this 4-bolter
content.protection: 2 anchors are at the top, and 4 draws for the climb.
content.location: First route right of the groove/depression in the middle of the wall.

content.description: A long route for this wall, the 2nd to last route you come to is this 6 bolted line.
content.protection: 2 anchors are at the top, and 6 draws for the climb.

content.description: the 2nd climb you see from the right on this wall.
content.protection: 4 bolts, chain anchors (shared with route to left).
content.location: Fourth route right of the groove/depression in the middle of the wall. Shares chains with route to left.

content.description: Climb the arete to the R side of the obvious black water runnel.  You can either stay on the arete (straight up the bolt line) or stem up the corner  by climbing L of the bolts (much easier) or some combination of both.  The crux is pulling the roof at the top; it's a little awkward with the holds being less positive than you would like.  Mantle out and trot up the remaining slab to the chains.  One of the longest routes on the wall.  Rock on the arete is still a little loose.  My belayer drilled me with a nice cobble so watch yourself.
content.location: Middle of the Road Kill Wall.  Shares chains with Listen to your Dinner.

content.description:
Canned Beaver is all about getting past the first three bolts and then enjoying a nice leisurely swim up to the anchors. Jason has extended this route and instead of only three bolts, it now climbs to the top of the formation as well as the two routes that flank both its left and right sides.

If climbing 5.7, is near your limit then stick clip the first bolt, as getting to it is the crux. Small finger pockets and cobbles are the name of the game here.

If climbing 5.7 is beyond your limit, then climb Porcupine Mush to the left and lean over and set up a toprope.

If climbing 5.7 is simple, then warm-up on this one and then hop on Armadillo Waffles to the right as it's one of Maple's harder 5.8's.

Canned Beaver is the fourth route from the left at the Road Kill Wall.
Very short and slightly overhanging route.  Scurry up a small dike, clip the 2 bolts, pull over to the low-angled face above and throw your rope in the open-topped hook to lower off.
content.protection: 2 bolts to a single spinner, open-topped hook (very mank IMHO).
content.location: At the beginning of the Road Kill Wall, a short, left-trending dike rises out of a small cave.

content.description: Just left of the groove is a 3 bolt route.
content.protection: 2 anchors are at the top, and 3 draws for the climb.
